meanings.sent1: Stop your wingeing and try to find a solution.
meanings.sent2: She tends to winge whenever things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: His constant wingeing about the weather is getting old.
meanings.sent4: The child's wingeing echoed through the house.
meanings.sent5: I can't stand the sound of constant wingeing.

meanings.definition: A high-pitched sound, as of a bird or insect
meanings.sent1: The winge of the bird filled the forest with music.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the cheerful winge of a robin outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The winge of the cricket added a peaceful background noise.
meanings.sent4: The winge of the bat pierced the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The winge of the hummingbird was a delight to hear.

meanings.sent1: The small winge of a mosquito can be quite irritating.
meanings.sent2: Don't let such a minor winge ruin your day.
meanings.sent3: The constant winge of a dripping faucet can drive you crazy.
meanings.sent4: The winge of a fly buzzing around can be surprisingly bothersome.
meanings.sent5: The persistent winge of a squeaky door can be easily fixed.
